intro: Turritis spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf turritis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Turritis spathulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
